title: Len Saldua
author: Len Saldua
content: Just spent a good couple of hours signing up and doing my KYC at Gate.io, only to have a frustrating experience. The interface is a mess, all I wanted to do was buy some damn token, so I did a trial buy on the Spot Trading section using "Limit Order" . I wanted to buy some POLIS tokens so I looked for the right pair ( POLIS/USDT ) and using some tiny USDT funds I had there I hit the "Buy" button. Nearly 12 hours later my order is still "pending" I check my Funds Overview and I only see the Tether Icon, there's no POLIS token there or anywhere ! Also my ticket has not been answered ! WTF !! All this trouble to buy one damn token ? Am I supposed to wait 48 hours or something ? What is this ? Not impressed !

comments.author: Franctoshi
comments.body: Such anoying and dull platform as well to me, I don't like using them either. I was using Gate.io as of 2020 but had a terrible experience with them as of that time ,then I had to dump them and use other user friendly platforms, though I don't know if there's any changes they've made so far in order to improve their platform. I suggest you should go try out this platforms when you're dealing with any centralized exchanges when carrying out your Cryptocurrency transaction, I do think they're better in my opinion. Check out the list below FTX,Binance, Kucoin.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Perhaps it has something to do with the specified price in the Limit Order? I am not using Gate but I am certain that using Limit Order has little to no difference compared to Binance. In Binance, there is a certain price limit you can set based on the Market Price of the asset. This means that you can't just open a buy order of $50 per coin when it is currently at a price of $75.In other words, you can't make a trade when the price you set is not close enough to the market price.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: What token do you want to buy? It can be a shit token. Which means the token may not have a good limit order price and if you use the market order, it can be a loss if you buy it as people are not demanding for the coin and make its market price to be very low than what appears on the market. Be careful when buying shit coins, you can buy at loss. Or what limit order price did you use. For example, if you want to buy bitcoin and its price is at $22000, a limit order at 19990 will not make the order filled unless bitcoin fall back to or below that price.I checked Coinmarketcap now, Gate.io 24 hours trading volume is $1,573,557,595.23. You can check that using this link: https://coinmarketcap.com/exchanges/gate-ioThe problem is not from Gate.io, there is something you are not getting right.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on July 19, 2022, 06:55:50 AM...What is this ? Not impressed ! I have not encountered such problems on this exchange. This exchange is used by me to buy new coins, of which there are a lot on this exchange, because unlike others, Gate.io conducts a free listing. Most likely, the problem is that you have incorrectly set the price of the limit order. Since POLICE has a low trading volume, you had to take this fact into account when opening a purchase order.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Is it the Star Atlas DAO(POLIS)?There's FTX and Kraken that you should have used more than them.Quote from: Franctoshi on July 19, 2022, 07:25:38 AMFTX,Binance, Kucoin. That token he's longing to buy isn't on the other two but only FTX if it's the Star Atlas DAO(Polis) that he's wanting to buy.Quote from: Len Saldua on July 19, 2022, 06:55:50 AMAm I supposed to wait 48 hours or something ? What is this ? Not impressed ! Contact Gate.io's support, they're the only one that can speed up your buy.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: In addition about those above users who already pointed out,You need to do you own research first before using any services, is there any reason why you're choose Gate.io instead of FTX or Kraken? because Gate.io is a shit exchange and shouldn't be used if your shitcoins doesn't only listed on that's exchanges.Don't get tricked with exchanges has fake trading volume e.g. MEXC, CoinTiger etc.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Using CMC you'll find out the reading volume which exchange platform has a higher volume.https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/star-atlas-polis/markets/I think the best pick is the FTX exchange platform here, it has a high volume percentage and also high liquidity.  That's also a good exchange compared to Gate.io.  I have been using this exchange since 3 years ago when they don't have a heavy restriction regarding KYC but when they have an upgrade of their KYC, I stopped using them.Quote from: blockman on July 19, 2022, 01:04:18 PMContact Gate.io's support, they're the only one that can speed up your buy.That's good advice and I tend to agree with this.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: If this was because you used a Limit order (which exists with almost every single exchange in the first place), then LOL. I'm guessing you're used to using the "swap" feature of some exchanges? Sure is convenient, but as far as I know you're paying for more fees.

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: Are you really sure that your order is already fulfilled because there's a high possibility that it's still open order since you used limit order and not market order if you want instantly purchased POLIS token based on the current liquidity in the market.I'm using gate before to buy newly listed token that is not listed yet on top tier exchange and I never encounter this same problem. In fact it's my first time to see this issue on limit order. Maybe the price that you set is too low while the price never reach that price level even 48hrs.

comments.author: Len Saldua
comments.body: Quite a good read. Nice !Okay so I went back to Gate and still no POLIS in my Account. And by the way, only Gate and possibly FTX have this token ( Star Atlas DAO ) that's why I went with Gate ( KYC on FTX is a bit more thorough )I guess I am not familiar with the "Limit Order" feature on Gate. In KuCoin, there is a Limit Order feature, which mostly I would never use, using the "Market Order" feature instead ( buy at whatever the current market price is ). Why doesn't Gate have this feature ? I don't even remember setting a specific price, as I've honestly never placed a limit order before, nor do I want to use this in the future after my awful experience, but just out of curiosity I went and looked at the set "Price" on Gate.  It's clearly $0.53. Price is now $0.58 but 24 hours ago when I set the order it would have been below $0.53 . So what gives ? Why didn't the order execute ? I still got nothing on my account, and even my Tether is gone now because it's assumed I want to go through with that order. So basically I lost my Tether and never got the POLIS token I wanted. Yes I can probably recover the Tether USDT by cancelling the order, but I sure as hell don't want to try another order now !!Drives me nuts because I also want to buy Enjinstarter, which is also only available on Gate !

comments.author: Len Saldua
comments.body: I'm thinking I will never figure out why this didn't work. Gate responded to my ticket but they closed the Ticket and marked it as "solved" not even giving me a chance to respond, even now !! And when you do respond, they give you a limit of 120 words or something which is absurd. My previous comment here was about 600 words, and I didn't even go into too much detail !!

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Why not try the "Buy Now" option using a market order, I think it will execute orders directly.As it will execute at the highest price and therefore the price may be higher than the average prices, but this is better than waiting for a long time.If the "market order" option does not work, you should contact the support team although I think it will.I don't know, but I will never buy a token listed on one or two platforms.

comments.author: Len Saldua
comments.body: I'm pretty sure I did click on the Buy token option. Anyway. I just noticed there is another feature on Gate... the Flash Swap. Tried it just now... but the tokens I want are not available using this.I did cancel the Limit Order though... so I got my Tether back. Not sure how to do it right but it seems spot trading in pairs is the only way to get that particular token.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: I don't think they have a market order shortcut as well... if you wanna do that, just place a buy order higher than the current market price. Say market price is $1, place it at $1.5. Don't worry, you won't be buying at a higher price because the better order will be matched for you which is at the current market price.

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: There is Star Atlas DAO (POLIS) https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/star-atlas-polis/markets/ and its listed on Gate.io and there is also another POLIS. Careful which one you would buy.I have tried gate when I was trading ZERO as it was first listed in gate when it started, I hurriedly register to buy, they being KYC right away.  DAO is becoming a good investment but its still an altcoin.

comments.author: Len Saldua
comments.body: Not sure I follow. But I tried Limit Order again before reading your post. If this doesn't work I will try what you suggested. Also contacted Gate again.Tiny amount as you can see, I don't really care about the token anymore... I want to make this work so that next time there is an opening I can use Gate.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on July 19, 2022, 08:54:24 PMNot sure I follow. But I tried Limit Order again before reading your post. If this doesn't work I will try what you suggested. Also contacted Gate again.https://i.imgur.com/VJjQpxN.jpgTiny amount as you can see, I don't really care about the token anymore... I want to make this work so that next time there is an opening I can use Gate.If you want the buy order to be executed immediately, increase your buy price. As you can see on the screenshot, the cheapest POLIS that's being sold is $0.5799. Place your buy price at the cheapest sell price or higher.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on July 19, 2022, 04:36:23 PMIt's clearly $0.53. Price is now $0.58 but 24 hours ago when I set the order it would have been below $0.53 .Maybe you just read the chart in a different place, I don't see the price history of the POLIS ever touching back $0.53 after going to $0.58.Quote from: Len Saldua on July 19, 2022, 04:36:23 PMI still got nothing on my account, and even my Tether is gone now because it's assumed I want to go through with that order. So basically I lost my Tether and never got the POLIS token I wanted.Your USDT just changed status to "in order", it doesn't really go away. Try to check the balance overview.I don't know how much you want to trade with that coin. You seem like the typical trader who welcomes KYC policies. You should be able to choose an exchange that has a better trading volume.

comments.author: Len Saldua
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on July 20, 2022, 03:53:55 AMIf you want the buy order to be executed immediately, increase your buy price. As you can see on the screenshot, the cheapest POLIS that's being sold is $0.5799. Place your buy price at the cheapest sell price or higher.Okay... so this is a bit like "bidding" for the token ? The higher your bid, the higher your chance of getting it sooner ? But that means in times of high volatility you may end up paying a much higher price than the current market value...
